business.headline: Delhi High Court tells Priya Kapur entire Sunjay Kapur asset list cannot be confidentialThe application was filed in the ongoing inheritance dispute involving Karishma Kapoor's children, who are claiming a share in their late father's personal assets.
Gold slips from record high. 3 factors explainedGold retreated from its record peak this week, leaving investors curious about what triggered the fall. Here are three key factors behind the dip.

Insurance complaints surge 45% in Q2 as health policies drive cases: ReportRising disputes reveal persistent mis-selling and transparency gaps in India's insurance sector, with policyholders increasingly turning to platforms like Insurance Samadhan to assert rights and seek timely redressal.

Missed the ITR deadline? You will now have to file under new tax regimeWondering what happens if you miss the ITR filing deadline? Did you know you'll automatically be shifted to the new tax regime, losing the option to choose the old one?

Which are the best sectors to invest on Dalal Street right now? Check best picksFrom FMCG to NBFCs, railways, autos and even shipbuilders, analysts see opportunities across a range of sectors as Dalal Street faces volatility.

Sensex, Nifty trade flat after opening lower amid F&O expiry, US visa curbsAt 9:28 am, the S&P BSE Sensex was up 95.55 points at 81,811.18, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 25.65 points to 25,082.55. Broader market indices also traded in the green, though overall sentiment on Dalal Street remained mixed.

Atlanta Electricals IPO allotment out: Check your status, listing date and GMPInvestors who applied for Atlanta Electricals IPO can check their allotment status through either the BSE website or the registrar's platform, MUFG Intime India Private Limited.

Government imposes import curbs on plain silver jewellery till March 2026The restrictions have been introduced in the wake of an import of plain silver jewellery from under preferential duty exemptions rising steeply during April-June 2024-25 to April-June 2025-26.
Should investors be cautious of IT stocks amid H-1B visa changes?With ongoing changes in visa fees and policies, analysts say the outlook for the sector has turned uncertain in the short run.

How NPCI powers half the world's digital payments on just Rs 500 croreNational Payments Corporation of India handles 46% of the world's digital transactions. UPI alone processes 3,729 transactions per second.

Cabinet clears Rs 1,866 crore productivity bonus for railway staffRailway employees are in for festive cheer as the Union Cabinet has approved a productivity-linked bonus, benefiting lakhs of staff members.

Should you have two credit cards? Here's what you need to knowCredit card usage is on the rise in India, and many people are wondering if having a second card makes sense. From rewards to financial flexibility, here's what you should know before applying for another card.

Sensex, Nifty end lower as profit booking continues; Tata Motors falls over 2%The S&P BSE Sensex fell 386.47 points to 81,715.63, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 112.60 points to close at 25,056.90. Broader market indices also ended lower, with sectoral breadth largely negative, except for pharma stocks, which managed modest gains.

Why your cashless insurance claim isn't always 'cashless'Cashless claims promise convenience, but long delays, unclear policies, and unjust deductions often leave patients stressed. Understanding your rights and navigating the system proactively can prevent financial and medical headaches.

PPF, SCSS, SSY: Are Small Saving Scheme interest rates set to change?As the September 30 announcement approaches, savers are wondering if interest rates on popular small saving schemes like PPF, SCSS, and Sukanya Samriddhi Yojana (SSY) will change. Here's what you need to know.

How to buy gold the right way this festive seasonGold shopping is a festive tradition for many Indian families, but with rising prices and endless options, making the right choice can feel tricky. Here's how you can buy gold the right way this season.

H-1B crackdown cracks the rupee. Know why INR hit an all-time lowEconomists estimate that remittances, the money Indians abroad send back, could drop by around $400 million. For a country that relies on foreign money flowing in, that's significant.

Union Cabinet likely to clear bonus for railway staff soon: Government sourcesThe bonus, usually extended to non-gazetted railway employees, is meant to recognise their contribution to the efficiency and performance of one of India's most crucial transport networks.

Income tax audit 2025: Deadlines, rules and penalties you must knowThe clock is ticking for taxpayers who fall under the audit bracket. With the income tax audit deadline for FY 2024–25 just around the corner, here's a quick look at key dates, rules, and penalties.

Confused between Swiggy and Eternal stock? Here's what experts suggestMarket experts say the two companies are in very different positions when it comes to earnings visibility and investor confidence.

Overcharged after GST rate cut? Here's how you can take actionExperts say that raising a complaint not only helps individual consumers reclaim their rightful benefit but also strengthens overall market accountability.

SBI shares gain 1% to hit 52-week high. Should you buy?SBI shares have seen an uptick in the past few days. This has been a reaction to the country's largest lender completing the sale of a part of its stake in YES Bank.

Sensex falls 300 points, Nifty below 25,100 as profit booking continuesAt 9:22 am, the S&P BSE Sensex declined 309 points to 81,792.86, and the NSE Nifty50 slipped 100 points to 25,069.45. Broader market indices also witnessed early losses, led by persistent selling pressure.

Epack Prefab, BMW Ventures, Jain Resource IPOs open today: Where should you bet?Three IPOs will open for bidding today. Epack Prefab Technologies, BMW Ventures, and Jain Resource Recycling begin their public subscriptions today.

What is silver SIP and is it better than gold this festive season?With gold already at peak levels, many investors are asking whether silver, especially through systematic investment plans (SIPs) in exchange traded funds (ETFs), could be a smarter choice this festive season.
GST buying bonanza kicks off, cars lead the wayPM Narendra Modi described GST 2.0 as "a reform dedicated to the people of India," and for many, the benefits were felt immediately.

Is your income tax refund less than Rs 10,000? Here's why it might reach you fasterMany taxpayers are frustrated with refund delays. But here's the catch, simpler refunds tend to move more quickly through the system than bigger claims.

Festive season stock picks: Which sectors are the best bet right now?Autos have already seen a sharp rally, while consumer durables, FMCG, PSU banks, and infrastructure are also emerging as areas to watch.

Sensex and Nifty end flat as IT losses offset consumer stock gainsThe S&P BSE Sensex slipped 11.83 points to 82,102.1, while the NSE Nifty50 settled 32.85 points lower at 25,169.50. The broader small- and mid-cap indices also lagged, declining 0.5% and 0.4%, respectively.

Indian-origin Srinivas Gopalan, Rahul Goyal appointed as CEOs of two big US companiesTwo major US companies have appointed Indian-origin CEOs. Telecom giant T-Mobile announced Srinivasan Gopalan will take over as CEO from November 1. Beverage major Molson Coors has chosen Rahul Goyal as its new CEO, effective October 1. Gopalan's appointment comes as the US wireless market faces challenges, including slowing subscriber growth and fierce competition. Goyal, a company veteran, has previously served in key roles including CFO of Molson Coors India. These appointments are notable amidst discussions around the H1B visa program in the US. A reporter noted, "Desi CEO for US Giants is the biggest news in the day for Telecom and IT space as well." This highlights the significance of these leadership changes in the corporate world.

Gold rises to all-time high. 3 reasons behind its strengthInvestors are flocking to gold as it climbs to record highs, supported by currency weakness, economic uncertainty, and inflationary pressures. Here are the three main drivers.

Denied, delayed, dismissed: Inside India's broken health insurance systemIn this special report, part of our 'CLAIM DENIED' series, we uncover why health insurance in India has become a gamble for families, as rising premiums, delayed settlements, and weak accountability leave them vulnerable when they need support most.

SIP vs SWP: How to turn your retirement corpus into reliable incomeAccumulating wealth through SIPs is just the beginning of retirement planning. The real challenge is turning that corpus into a steady income. Here's how you can do it.

PF pre-retirement withdrawal rules likely to be relaxed: ReportAt present, EPFO members can withdraw their entire corpus only after reaching the retirement age of 58, or if they remain unemployed for more than two months.

Launching a startup? This government scheme simplifies early fundingStarting a startup is exciting but securing funds at the initial stage is often a hurdle. This government scheme provides seed funding through incubators, giving you the financial boost to test, prototype, and launch your product.

ITR-5 and ITR-7 filing opens online. Who can file and by when?The Income Tax Department has opened online filing for ITR-5 and ITR-7 forms for AY 2025–26. These forms are not meant for individuals but for specific entities. Here's a quick look at who needs to file and the deadlines.

Who is Srini Gopalan, T-Mobile's new Indian-origin CEOSrini Gopalan will take over from Mike Sievert, who has been named Vice Chairman. Mike Sievert, the outgoing CEO, said that Gopalan was the natural choice to take T-Mobile forward.

Gold shines at an all-time high, but is it safe to invest?The yellow metal, traditionally seen as a safe haven in uncertain times, has surged sharply in the past year, supported by global factors ranging from geopolitical tensions to central bank buying.

Take that, MAGA. Two big US firms appoint Indian-origin CEOs amid H-1B crackdownAmid H-1B tensions, two Indian-origin executives, Srinivas Gopalan and Rahul Goyal, rise to top US leadership roles, defying Make America Great Again (MAGA) hardliners and reshaping America's corporate landscape.

Markets edge higher, auto stocks lead early gains; volatility loomsThe Sensex climbed nearly 100 points in early trade, while the Nifty50 hovered above 25,200. Broader indices, however, struggled to find traction as pockets of profit booking introduced early volatility.

entertainment.headline: Bigg Boss 19 episode 32: Farrhana beats Ashnoor, secures captaincy contendership Farrhana Bhatt secured her captaincy contendership this week in 'Bigg Boss 19' by beating Ashnoor Kaur in the drone task. She later had a huge fight with another contestant, Kunickaa Sadanand, after the latter called her selfish.

KBC 17: Gujarat teacher shares Turner Syndrome struggle, hopes for motherhood Contestant Jigna Mokaria, a teacher with Turner syndrome, secured Rs 7,50,000 on 'Kaun Banega Crorepati' 17. She shared her experiences of societal judgment and her aspirations for motherhood via surrogacy.

They Call Him OG paid previews: Pawan Kalyan smashes Pushpa 2, Stree 2 records Pawan Kalyan's 'They Call Him OG' released in theatres on September 25. Ahead of the grand premiere, the film has managed to break 'Pushpa 2' and 'Stree 2' records with its paid previews.

Two Much premiere falls flat, lacks fun even with Salman and Aamir on the couch Actors Salman Khan and Aamir Khan appeared in the premiere episode of 'Two Much' but failed to deliver expected excitement. Read more to see if the show is worth watching.

The Ba***ds of Bollywood: A nostalgic ride for cinephiles 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood' is a celebration of old hits, OG villains and 2000s nostalgia. Cinephiles, especially Hindi cinema lovers, are taking a trip down memory lane, all thanks to debutant director Aryan Khan.

Salman Khan recalls struggles with trigeminal neuralgia: Took hour to eat breakfast Salman Khan discussed his struggles with trigeminal neuralgia, a severe nerve disorder. The actor details the challenges of diagnosis and undergoing lengthy surgery on Kajol and Twinkle Khanna's show 'Two Much'.

Rihanna and A$AP Rocky announce birth of third child, reveal baby's name Singer Rihanna and her partner, A$AP Rocky, announced the birth of their third child. The couple shared the first image of their child on social media.

Zubeen Garg's last film is a musical love story and fans will love it, says wife Late singer Zubeen Garg's wife, Garima, shared her resolve to complete his last film 'Roi Roi Binale'. Despite the sadness of his death, she is dedicated to honouring his legacy and fulfilling his unfinished work for his fans.

Shah Rukh Khan's National Award for Jawan: Three decades too late? Shah Rukh Khan wins his first National Award in 2025 for 'Jawan'. More than a single performance, the honour marks a long-overdue recognition of SRK's three-decade legacy, iconic films, and unmatched cultural impact.

Sunny Leone reacts to Anurag Kashyap, Vikramaditya Motwane's AI criticism Actor Sunny Leone recently addressed the concerns around the use of artificial intelligence (AI) in cinema. She also highlighted the relevance of AI-driven cinema in the entertainment industry.

In an exclusive chat with India Today, filmmaker-actor Anurag Kashyap revealed why he kept newcomers away from interviews ahead of 'Nishaanchi's' release. He praised Aaishvary Thackeray's impressive debut while brushing aside nepotism concerns.

Parineeti Chopra's playful anniversary wish for Raghav Chadha has a Paris twist Actor Parineeti Chopra wished her politician husband, Raghav Chadha, on their second wedding anniversary with a dash of humour. The reference to Paris in their social media post was unmissable. Check it out.

general news.headline: Aaditya Thackeray teases 'vote chori' surgical strike after Rahul Gandhi's expose"We have already written to the EC before the elections last year over the sudden spike in voters, about missing voters and why the booths have been mismanaged," Aaditya Thackeray said while promising a Rahul Gandhi-like expose on the poll body soon.

When Hindu woman marries, her 'gotra' changes: Supreme Court in succession caseThese remarks came while the top court was hearing a plea challenging Section 15(1)(b) of the Hindu Succession Act, 1956, which provides that when a Hindu woman dies intestate, her property passes to her husband's heirs if she leaves no husband or children.

Can even a scratch by a dog or cat cause rabies? Here's what doctors sayThe death of a policeman in Ahmedabad from rabies after being scratched by a family friend's pet dog has raised questions about whether even minor scratches can transmit the virus, and has brought to the fore concerns over pet safety and vaccination. This is what doctors have to say.

sports.headline: India's fielding lapses can cost them later: Irfan Pathan warns ahead of Asia Cup final India's fielding lapses have raised alarms ahead of the Asia Cup final. NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.
